perturbation.original_text: WHEREAS, Licensor and its affiliates, including Palmer Square BDC Advisor LLC, a Delaware limited liability company ("Investment Advisor"), have used the marks "Palmer Square", "Palmer Square Capital" and derivations thereof (the "Licensed Mark") in the United States of America and certain other jurisdictions (collectively, the "Territory") in connection with the investment management, investment consultation and investment advisory services they provide;
perturbation.changed_text: WHEREAS, Licensor and its affiliates, including Palmer Square BDC Advisor LLC, a Delaware limited liability company ("Investment Advisor"), have used the marks "Palmer Square", "Palmer Square Capital" and derivations thereof (the "Licensed Mark") in specific parts of the United States of America and no other jurisdictions (collectively, the "Territory") in connection with some investment management, investment consultation and investment advisory services they provide;
perturbation.explanation: The modified text limits the 'Territory' to 'specific parts' of the US and restricts the investment services to 'some' rather than all. This contradicts the original broad scope of the 'Territory' and the services covered by the Licensed Mark. Trademark rights and usage are usually defined by a specific territory, but this change introduces uncertainty regarding which parts of the US are included and what services are covered, weakening the trademark protection and contradicting standard trademark law.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Trademark Act of 1946 (Lanham Act) - establishes a national system for trademark protection. This modification creates ambiguity about the scope of the trademark rights.

perturbation.original_text: Subject to the terms and conditions of this Agreement, Licensor hereby grants to Licensee, and Licensee hereby accepts from Licensor, a personal, non-exclusive, royalty-free right and license to use the Licensed Mark solely and exclusively as a component of Licensee's own corporate name and in connection with marketing the investment management, investment consultation and investment advisory services that Investment Advisor may provide to Licensee.
perturbation.changed_text: Subject to the terms and conditions of this Agreement, Licensor hereby grants to Licensee, and Licensee hereby accepts from Licensor, a general, exclusive, royalty-bearing right and license to use the Licensed Mark both generally and specifically as a component of Licensee's own corporate name and separate from any connection with marketing the investment management, investment consultation and investment advisory services that Investment Advisor may provide to Licensee.
perturbation.explanation: The terms 'personal, non-exclusive, royalty-free, and solely and exclusively as a component' are directly contradicted by 'general, exclusive, royalty-bearing, and separate from any connection.' This introduces substantial uncertainty as to the nature and extent of the trademark license. The original agreement limited use, while the modified text broadens it significantly, creating a legal contradiction and contradicting the initial intent.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Contract Law - elements of offer, acceptance, and consideration must be clear. The contradiction muddles the agreement terms making the contract unenforceable.

perturbation.original_text: The parties agree that Investment Advisor shall be a third party beneficiary of this Agreement, and shall have the rights and protections provided to Licensee under this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: The parties agree that Investment Advisor shall have no third party beneficiary rights in this Agreement, and shall not have the rights and protections provided to Licensee under this Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: This change directly negates the third-party beneficiary status of Investment Advisor. This contradicts the initial agreement. The original clause grants specific rights, while the changed clause denies them entirely, creating a direct legal conflict.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Contract Law - Third-party beneficiary doctrine. The modification completely removes rights initially granted, creating a contradiction.
